author: Elastic
attributes.description: Detects successful single sign-on (SSO) events to Okta applications from an unrecognized or "unknown" client device, as identified by the user-agent string. This activity may be indicative of exploitation of a vulnerability in Okta's Classic Engine, which could allow an attacker to bypass application-specific sign-on policies, such as device or network restrictions. The vulnerability potentially enables unauthorized access to applications using only valid, stolen credentials, without requiring additional authentication factors.
attributes.name: Successful Application SSO from Rare Unknown Client Device
attributes.query:
event.dataset: "okta.system"
    and event.action: "user.authentication.sso"
    and event.outcome: "success"
    and okta.client.device: ("Unknown" or "unknown")
tags: Use Case: Identity and Access Audit
